TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content: Hey Beale, is there any chance we could get the Pol in 1.25? Or a tweakscale version so we can change the size?

Hey Beale, is there any chance we could get the Pol in 1.25? Or a tweakscale version so we can change the size?

the pol is that small in order to distinguish itself from the other unmanned supply craft. The Progress/Hamal is intended as the 1.25m supply ship

Venera

It almost didn't make it - well the orbiter at least. My "Blok D" had a paltry 1200 ÃŽâ€v. The orbiter did get into orbit, but it's a highly elliptical one. I first corrected the whole craft into a collision course with EVE, like Venera had with Venus, the released the sphere. Once the probe had landed, I returned to the orbiter and did a retro burn and barely got captured in orbit...

Beale, how do you figure the ÃŽâ€v of your block D? (as in what is it?)

Edited March 11, 2015 by tg626

Oh, wait. PPTS is in the works finally? That's awesome!! It's about time we get a gorgeous Tantares alternative to the stock's rather ugly Mk1-2 Command Pod (I never use it due to it's boring awful look and awkward door placement). Still waiting for the next mod version with that Gemini IVA RPM support though.

Beale?

perfect work on the Block D ... i love the attitude trusters for teh engine

Thanks! I hope you enjoy it.

http://vsm.host.ru/photos/lkeng.jpg

I love rocket engine clusters :3

Yeah, this is what I'm going more for. It looks a little more unique.

Yay! PPTS is arriving!
The PPTS hype is real.

It's going to take a while, I'm afraid

Gotta say the Blok D is looking fabulous. I wish I had the patience to model and texture.

Many thanks!

You are of course welcome to the model and texture files if you would like to take a look at them.

Any ideas on how to rebalance the Proton/ALV for 6.4x? I have a space station that needs launching.

A lazy method, but you could just bump up the ISP, to maybe 400 or so? You can argue it's a LH2/LOX Proton.

Nice PLANETES reference.

Hehe,

A few Planetes parts I'd like to give a try to make:

Fishbone, for TKS cargo bay.

KAS-grabbable De-orbit thruster, for getting rid of junk.

Hey Beale, is there any chance we could get the Pol in 1.25? Or a tweakscale version so we can change the size?

do you have module manager?

Try something like this for each Pol part 


@PART[Pollux_Control_A]
{
	@rescaleFactor = 2.5
}

This will make it a 1.25m diameter part!

Venera

Wow! Really nice orbiter.

Your question: I tried to make a quick and dirty replica, it has 3,000m/s overall (if the LOK Engine remains fueled).

The Blok-D alone will only manage about 1,600m/s if the LOK is emptied out, which is okay I guess.

Still waiting for the next mod version with that Gemini IVA RPM support though.

Very close now - just the LK legs and IVA, then go for release.
Fine by me!
Whoa,whoa,whoa! I watched the first episode of Planetes and at the start there was a spacecraft named Alnair! Is that where the ideas for names come from?

Whoa,whoa,whoa! I watched the first episode of Planetes and at the start there was a spacecraft named Alnair! Is that where the ideas for names come from?

A few other spacecraft names from Planetes: Vega, Libra, Almach!

Of course, they are just star / constellation names also. But yeah, it was a heavy influence.

Also one of the agencies was named "Alnair 2068", before renaming it to "Alnair Design Bureau".

I'm not a Weeaboo, honest.

Edited March 11, 2015 by Beale

Wow! Really nice orbiter.

Your question: I tried to make a quick and dirty replica, it has 3,000m/s overall (if the LOK Engine remains fueled).

The Blok-D alone will only manage about 1,600m/s if the LOK is emptied out, which is okay I guess.

http://puu.sh/gvKU4/467b4469ba.jpg

Oh, I'm not as far off as I thought (hoped) LOL. I have about the same numbers, +/- 20m/s - tho my TWR is way lower at 0.54 or something close to it... In case you're wondering, that Blok D stand-in is a part from the "TurboNisu Reloaded" parts pack. It's simply a "naked" 1.25 to 2.5 adapter tank, holding 270 LF and 330 OX.

A few other spacecraft names from Planetes: Vega, Libra, Almach!

Of course, they are just star / constellation names also. But yeah, it was a heavy influence.

Also one of the agencies was named "Alnair 2068", before renaming it to "Alnair Design Bureau".

I'm not a Weeaboo, honest.

Finally!

Yeah, I think you may still find the margins for a Venera flight quite slim even with my Blok-D. (Which actually holds exactly the same 270 LF and 330 OX!).

Found a bug - the landing legs.

If you start with them deployed, launch, hit G to retract , hit G again to extend, then hit G a third time to retract (and on any further extend/retract cycles) the legs "snap" into place instead of going through the animation.

Basically, they only go through the retract animation the first time you retract them.

Confirmed:

State at launch: Deployed

First G press - Normal retraction

Second G press - Normal deployment

Third G press - Instant retraction

Subsequent G presses repeat "Second" and "Third" above.

State at launch: Retracted

First G press - Normal deployment

Second G Press - Instant retraction

Subsequent G presses repeat this pattern

Missing Keyframe?

- - - Updated - - -

R.I.P. Venera 10!

Again, nice job. Is this the "Columbia Broadcasting System" again? I like the presentation style.

Thank you!! I try to make it a bit different.

And, weep not for Venera - even tho this is career, I allow myself to revert in the event of something like this happening (it's either that or bounce back and forth with Sandbox and experiment, so what's the difference?)

Here is the successful Parking Orbit to Eve flight! (not so KBS styled since there are no TV cameras in space LOL)

While launching my M-1 (finally!) I saw that the ALV-C engine would flame out when attached to a procedural tank, saying it's oxidizer deprived. A fuel line running from the tank to the engine fixed this, and I haven't tested it with a regular tank yet, but I should tell you.

EDIT: it does work when attched to the stock tanks, so it must be an issue with the procedural tank.

EDIT2: every time I try to launch a Zarya, I have trouble with the upper stage. It must be cursed.

EDIT3: screenshots!

It's unfortunate that I'm out of town right now and I can't try out the new LK parts. Looking forward to using them when I get back. In the meantime, I'll be working on some new models I started this week... this pack has inspired me to get back into mod-making. Thanks Beale.
